root:
Infobox Planet name = Helene image = [[File:Cassini Helene N00086698 CL.jpg.jpg]] bgcolour = #a0ffa0 discovery = yes discoverer = [[Pierre Laques|Laques]] and
[[Jean Lecacheux|Lecacheux]] discovered = March 1, 1980 semimajor = 377,396 km eccentricity = 0.0022 period = 2.736915 d ref[http://exp.arc.nasa.gov/downloads/celestia/data/solarsys.ssc NASA Celestia] inclination = 0.199° (to Saturn's equator) satellite_of = [[Saturn]] physical_characteristics = yes mean_radius = 16 km dimensions = 36 × 32 × 30 km rotation = assumed [[synchronous rotation|synchronous]] albedo = 1.67 ± 0.20 ([[geometric albedo|geometric]])ref name=Verbiscer[[Anne Verbiscer|Verbiscer, A.]]; [[Richard French|French, R.]]; [[Mark Showalter|Showalter, M.]]; and [[Paul Helfenstein|Helfenstein, P.]]; [http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/315/5813/815 ''Enceladus: Cosmic Graffiti Artist Caught in the Act''], Science, Vol. 315, No. 5813 (February 9, 2007), p. 815 (supporting online material, table S1) axial_tilt = zero '''Helene''' (pron-enˈhɛlɨniː respellHELə-nee, sometimes IPA-enhɨˈliːniː respellhəLEEnee, or as in Greek ''Ἑλένη)'' is a [[natural satellite|moon]] of [[Saturn]]. It was discovered by [[Pierre Laques]] and [[Jean Lecacheux]] in 1980 from ground-based observations at [[Pic du Midi Observatory]], and was designated '''nowrapS/1980 S 6.'''ref[http://cfa-www.harvard.edu/iauc/03400/03496.html IAUC 3496: ''Satellites of Saturn''] 1980 July 31 (discovery) In 1988 it was officially named after [[Helen]] of [[Troy]], who was the granddaughter of [[Cronus]] (Saturn) in [[Greek mythology]].ref[http://cfa-www.harvard.edu/iauc/04600/04609.html IAUC 4609: ''Satellites of Saturn and Uranus''] 1988 June 8 (naming the moon) The moon is also designated '''nowrapSaturn XII''', a number which it received in 1982, under the designation '''Dione B''',refTransactions of the International Astronomical Union, Vol. XVIIIA, 1982 (mentioned in [http://cfa-www.harvard.edu/iauc/03800/03872.html IAUC 3872: ''Satellites of Jupiter and Saturn''], 1983 September 30) because it is co-orbital with [[Dione (moon)|Dione]] and located in its leading [[Lagrangian point]] (L4). __NOTOC__ == Exploration == The closest images of Helene are from the [[Cassini-Huygens|Cassini]] spacecraft's 36,000 km fly-by in 2007. Helene will be the target of a much closer fly-by (1800 km) during Cassini's extended mission on 2010 March 3. == Gallery == gallery Image:Helene moon.jpg|''[[Voyager 2]]'' image of Helene. Image:Cassini Helene N00051429 CL.png|''[[Cassini-Huygens]]'' image taken February 2006 == References == reflist == External links == * [http://solarsystem.nasa.gov/planets/profile.cfm?Object=Sat_Helene Helene Profile] by [http://solarsystem.nasa.gov NASA's Solar System Exploration] * [http://www.planetary.org/explore/topics/saturn/helene.html The Planetary Society: Helene] Moons of Saturnstate=uncollapsed DEFAULTSORT:Helene (Moon) [[Category:Moons of Saturn]] [[als:Helene (Mond)]] [[bg:Елена (спътник)]] [[ca:Helena (satèl·lit)]] [[cs:Helene (měsíc)]] [[co:Elena (astrunumia)]] [[cy:Helene (lloeren)]] [[da:Helene (måne)]] [[de:Helene (Mond)]] [[el:Ελένη (δορυφόρος)]] [[eml:Elena (astronomî)]] [[es:Helena (satélite)]] [[eo:Heleno (luno)]] [[fr:Hélène (lune)]] [[hr:Helena (mjesec)]] [[it:Elena (astronomia)]] [[lt:Elenė (palydovas)]] [[nl:Helene (maan)]] [[ja:ヘレネ (衛星)]] [[no:Helene (måne)]] [[nn:Saturnmånen Helene]] [[pl:Helena (księżyc)]] [[ro:Helene (satelit)]] [[ru:Елена (спутник)]] [[simple:Helene (moon)]] [[sk:Helene (mesiac)]] [[sl:Helena (luna)]] [[fi:Helene (kuu)]] [[sv:Helene]] [[uk:Гелена (супутник)]] [[zh:土卫十二]]
